website_summaries.verdict: Top-of-the-line digital noise-canceling headphones truly eliminate external sound. Control wirelessly with easy-access controls on right ear cup.
pros: These headphones truly cancel background sound
The smart feature will monitor an environment's sound and adjust accordingly
Excellent battery life and quick to charge
Superior sound quality with booming bass and crystal-clear treble
cons: Users report hinge on ear cup can become creaky over time

customer_reviews.title: the sound and noise cancelling is very good. Broken headband from regular use (CHEAP PLASTIC)
customer_reviews.text: I have to say the sound and noise cancelling of this is pretty awesome. Unfortunatley that's moot because after a month and a half of regular use the side of the headband cracked. Rendering it useless. Looked online and saw there are MANY people with the same problem and concerns. Someone from Sony even left a comment under a review on Amazon saying the issue has been looked at and "measures had been taken". Contacted Sony about a repair / replace and was told that wouldn't happen. Even though it's their defective product. They are the ones who chose to use cheap plastic on 400 dollar headphones, I'm the one paying for it. I'm never buying Sony again.
customer_reviews.author: E.B.

customer_reviews.title: Bad
customer_reviews.text: Just a great pair of headphones with a superb sound quality. Well done Sony. Update: well yes great sound quality, but after 5 months, same problem as previous model, mine got broken as usual at the headband.According to Sony, this is "physical damage".. Now I took good care of them and put them always in the original case... Omg Sony... What a disaster. Exactly today I was considering to pre-order the new camera Sony A73.... Well I might think twice after this treatment.
customer_reviews.author: Client d'Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Amazing, but...
customer_reviews.text: Easily the best sounding bluetooth wireless in the price range. However, they just aren't as comfortable as Bose QuietComfort which is a huge bummer. My ears fatigue from the pressure and if headphones aren't comfortable, you don't wear them. It won't matter if they sound better than other headphones. I can wear my Bose all day. I can wear my Sony's for about two to three hours before my ears tire from the pressure and uncomfortable ear pads. You will have to decide what's more important to you: comfort or best sound.
customer_reviews.author: Rodrigo

customer_reviews.title: Worst plastic ever
customer_reviews.text: The plastic is really bad. They broke within the 3rd use :( I love the sound of Sonys, i have many wired pairs, and when I baught this I expected them to be from the same quality materials, but with the most expensive headphones come the biggest disappointment from Sony. For those couple of hours I was able to use them, I have to say that the sound was fantastic. I'll still ude the cheaper, wired ones. But for the wireless I'll buy Bose probably.
customer_reviews.author: Olya Katsel

customer_reviews.title: ... stars because the sound quality and battery life are great but when a previous model is notorious for cracking
customer_reviews.text: I really want to give these 4 - 5 stars because the sound quality and battery life are great but when a previous model is notorious for cracking, and you see in the comments that Sony supposedly addressed the cracking issue so you buy a pair and they crack (image attached), it's difficult to justify. The bottom line for me is I'm not willing to spend $300 on a pair of headphones that break after about 5 months of gentle use.
customer_reviews.author: Nickolas Fellows

customer_reviews.title: The Headband broke in less than 6 months
customer_reviews.text: The headphone break in less than 6 months so I assume that the build material is cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Othman

customer_reviews.title: Great sound but too heavy/too tight; hurts my ears!
customer_reviews.text: Great great quality of sound! This unit comes with diverse product features that can be interpreted as good value from a consumer's perspective. HOWEVER, no way to listen to music more than an hour because TOO heavy and the ear cups were somewhat smaller than mine (Don't think that my ears are far beyond average; mines are smaller than average). Too heavy, too tight mean very uncomfortable, although sound was the best one I've tried so far. It ended with returning it, thereby.
customer_reviews.author: MY

customer_reviews.title: Complete Junk. Unable to take a Charge after 3 Months!
customer_reviews.text: Complete junk. Stopped charging only 3 months after I received them and there is a no return policy after two months.
customer_reviews.author: paul hoffman

customer_reviews.title: Same defect
customer_reviews.text: Same headband problem like last generations, broke on the plastic by the ear cup, however the metal band is the only thing saving it. I'll probably super glue it back together since the cup doesn't perfectly cover my ears now letting in outside noise. Sony's warranty doesn't even cover it even though it's poor craftsmanship by Sony
customer_reviews.author: Hunter

customer_reviews.title: These are hands down the better headphones. I will say that the Bose QC35 ...
customer_reviews.text: Switched from the Bose QC35 II to these. These are hands down the better headphones. I will say that the Bose QC35 is more comfortable. The ear cups are softer and seem to provide a little more space. That being said, these are by no means uncomfortable and I wear them 6+ hours per day. The touch controls are great, the battery life is awesome, the bluetooth range is at LEAST 3X that of the Bose. They support higher quality protocols, the noise cancelling is better in my opinion. All good stuff. Definitely worth the few extra dollars. To Sony: I really wish the LEDs could be optionally disabled via the app.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Nothom

customer_reviews.title: Sound leaks when wearing; cabin pressure can be bothersome; sound quality is nice; headband creaks
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality is nice and they're pretty comfortable in cool environments. They get a little stuffy if you're in a warm environment though. The sound leaks through more than I would've expected. When listening at a medium volume level, people around can still hear what you're listening to. The cabin pressure effect is pretty strong with these too. I have trouble wearing them for more than an hour at a time. Update: After four months of occasional use, the headband hinges have started to make creaking noises. Probably related to Sony using cheap plastic on their premium headphones. It's particularly
customer_reviews.author: James W

customer_reviews.title: No Bluetooth? You are out of luck.
customer_reviews.text: These headphones power down in 4-5 minutes if not connected to Bluetooth. In other words, for the duration of a 3 hour flight, the Bluetooth on your phone needs to be on whether you are listening to audio or not; and, while the battery on the headphones survives, the battery on your phone may not. Seems like a bug since this cannot be by design. Though I use them for audio, the primary reason for buying these is noise cancellation, so these will be returned and I will go back to Bose which, amazingly, just cancel noise without dictating a limited set of circumstances under which they do so.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Save your money or buy a different brand.
customer_reviews.text: I've had these headphones for 9 months and there is good and bad. The good: Noise cancelling works amazing. I primarily used them for the gym and it tuned out all the noise. The sound quality is awesome but I must say that the XB950BT are much louder. The bad: I really wanted to like these. First of all, the quality of the band sucks. Second, the touch buttons aren't that great. Lastly and the most disappointing, the headphones stopped working. I started charging them and when I tried to turn them on, they wouldn't turn on. I regret purchasing these and should have gone with Bose or even a lower quality like Beats.
customer_reviews.author: Hugo V.

customer_reviews.title: Sony vs. Bose
customer_reviews.text: I have the Bose 35 and the Sony WH1000, and I’ve gotta say... I like them both! They both have strengths I’ll list, see which matter to you: Bose Plus’s 1. More comfortable for long flights 2. Fold down flatter for packing Sony Plus’s 1. At max volume they don’t distort bass 2. I think they sound a touch better. Just barely! I listen to music loud and I can honestly say you’ll like both headphones. So just choose what matters to you.
customer_reviews.author: Shane

customer_reviews.title: Junk.  Don’t buy these headphones.  Search for “headphones won’t charge” on the web.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered on 1/2/2018. On 3/1/2018 headphones stopped working. Won’t charge at all. Plug in, red light on for 2 minutes, then goes off. Not charging! To late to return to amazon. Found several people on the web with the same issue. Also heard Sony support horrendous. Wish me luck dealing with them
customer_reviews.author: D. Evans

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic headphones
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are fantastic. I was a little hesitant about people saying that parts of the headband break but I’ve used them nearly every day for half a year now, often times not treating them as well as I should!, and there has been no sign of cracking or breaking. The noise canceling is fantastic, I put them on for my morning commute just so they can drown out the subway but the voice of the announcer still comes through clear. And the sound quality is great, well balanced without that bass pumping you get from some brands. This is a nice, clean sound that works well for all categories of music.
customer_reviews.author: Casey Harding

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: This is the most expensive headphones I've ever purchased. I am not a electronic expert but I am very happy with this even though it's expensive. I bought this mainly because my neighbor is loud just when I have to go to sleep. I know it's crazy but I use this to block the sound so I could sleep through the nice and it does!!! Expensive ear plugs lol...I also use it to listen to music and I love it. Feel like I am in a different world. I do wish that it syncs with my TV. That would be so great to watch TV with this quality headphone. So it's a good buy for me.
customer_reviews.author: S. Loh

customer_reviews.title: No brainer
customer_reviews.text: I was like most people, struggling to decide to pick this or the qc35 ii. I tried both at Bestbuy and decided to go with this. The sound is much better. The media playback functions are much easier to use. Just swipe or tap on the right earcup. Mich more natural than the multi function button in Bose. This is also very comfortable enough for my 2 hour gym session. Not to mention I bought this when it was on sale. So $50 cheaper than Bose.
customer_reviews.author: Sneaking Sniper

customer_reviews.title: Life saver....Literally!
customer_reviews.text: Wow. Just...wow. My company moved to open plan recently. The noise cancelling feature has literally saved lives (of my coworkers). Phones fit great (I'm a big dude) are light and comfortable and come with an awesome carrying case and adapters for airplane seats. Amazing design and function. The atmospheric pressure adjustment is a huge plus for air travel, as is the ability to change the level of noise cancelling.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Great noise-canceling headphones at a less than Bose price
customer_reviews.text: I love these headphones, they do a great job filtering out noise and work well for air travel, phone meetings, or just listening to music. They cost much less than Bose headphones and are comparable - I've tried them side by side and there's no difference in their noise canceling. The right side has controls that are invisible: you just tap and/or swipe on them to pause, fast forward, or skip. Those controls are a bit touchy, that's really my only complaint, and you can accidentally set them off just by adjusting the fit. Otherwise, great headphones and I highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Scharff

customer_reviews.title: EXPENSIVE, but GREAT headphones
customer_reviews.text: These are some great headphones! I don't travel all that often, so I mainly use these at work and in coffee shops. It completely blocks out the sound and I often forget people are around. The only time I can hear some sounds is when the I'm in between tracks. When listening to podcasts it feels like you're out in the audience listening. i often close my eyes to complete the experience. These are very comfortable for me. I have small ears that fit perfectly inside the cups. I read in reviews that it can get uncomfortable for people with bigger ears. Will definitely use these on my airplane ride back home!
customer_reviews.author: Rod

customer_reviews.title: Sony doesn't stand behind its quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought the gold one October 2017, and after 11 month of daily use during commute, I found cracks on the hinge, which has happened to the first generation, and also many other second generation units. Sony claimed that they have fixed the issue, but apparently they didn't. What's worth, I contacted Sony customer services and customer relations, both said that this is physical damage, thus voiding the warranty, and their engineers believe that there is no weak spot on the unit, regardless of so many user complaints since the launch. Good jobs Sony engineer! I really enjoyed the headphone, but I don't want to spend $300+ buying something that can only be used for less a year.
customer_reviews.author: Monova Fu

customer_reviews.title: A high quality headset
customer_reviews.text: The noise cancellation and far better than other competing brands, and the quality of the speakers is great. I always carry it with me when I travel. It holds its charge for a long time. You can go for a round trip trans-Atlantic fly without a need for a recharge. The only downside is the material quality, which doesn't feel sturdy at all. However, since I always take an extra care when I use my stuff, it doesn't bother me.
customer_reviews.author: Armila

customer_reviews.title: ... Sony noise cancelling headphones and these by far are superior. On an airplane these can cancel almost 100% ...
customer_reviews.text: I had a previous pare of Sony noise cancelling headphones and these by far are superior. On an airplane these can cancel almost 100% of the ambient noise. They are also comfortable enough to sleep in during the flight. Unlike my other Bluetooth headphones these never lose the signal, stays strong any distance in my house. I highly recommend these!
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: These Sony headphones are the standard to compare all others for 2018
customer_reviews.text: Premium headphones in look and build quality. When I put these on, the outside world is silent. Different listening modes means you will enjoy all of your music like new again. The headphones feel comfortable. The touch controls are intuitive and an added bonus for tech junkies. Wow, get these. Life is short, listen to music.
customer_reviews.author: Evan

customer_reviews.title: Happy Guy In City of Sin
customer_reviews.text: After spending a week with these headphones all i can is wow. There very comfortable with plus like leather. And the Noise cancelation with the Sony app is spot on either when I start walking out my apt or sitting on the bus the headphones with the app adjust noise canceling levels accordingly. Not sure about the headband cracking since I haven't had them that long but they seem fine. I'm very happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I am obsessed with these. They cancel so much noise, sound beautiful, and look very cool. They are pretty heavy and relatively large though. Not really an outfit addition, but that didn't matter to me. I use them to commute and block out people talking at work. They make commuting bearable and they work great. I love the feature that temporarily dims your music and boosts ambient noise. It makes it so easy to talk to people without pausing and taking off my headphones. I tried the newest Beats and Bose and other popular leading headphones, and they didn't match the noise cancelling and sound quality of the new Sonys.
customer_reviews.author: Gretchen

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy until Sony fixes the Sony Headphones Connect App at least read the app reviews first
customer_reviews.text: The product is great, but don’t buy it until Sony fixes the app. The app that connects the headphones to your devices is terrible!!! Read the reviews on Sony Headphones Connect. For you buy the product. Don’t buy the headphones until Sony fixes the app! You have been warned.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Sound Quality; Terrible Plastic Quality
customer_reviews.text: I held out for many years since I never felt like the Bose options had sound quality that justified the NC price, but Sony finally released an option with noise cancellation that rivaled Bose with these 1000xm2. I used them for six months on dozens of flights and they were awesome; I don't think you can buy better sounding bluetooth headphones. But a few weeks ago these cracked at the pivot, just as many other customers have noted. I can't find replacement parts online. 350 bucks down the toilet. I wonder if someday we will be able to buy a good sounding high quality bluetooth headphone.
customer_reviews.author: Teque5

customer_reviews.title: Best Headphones I've ever used.
customer_reviews.text: These are the best headphones I have ever used! I have tried multiple different brands of headphones, but these are on a different level. The sound cancelling is also really nice if you are going on long flights etc. The battery life on these also is really good, they will last a very long time between charges. I did have a couple issues when connecting to them, but that's because I didn't download the software they instructed me to, so you will need the app on your phone. Also super nice controls on these.
customer_reviews.author: I. Radas

customer_reviews.title: Will update this review when I receive the replacement. ...
customer_reviews.text: Will update this review when I receive the replacement. I have had this product in my wish list for weeks, and have been visiting Target to try them on and test them - just to make sure I was making the right buying decision. You know, $299+ is a lot of money! So anyway, I bit the bullet yesterday and purchased them with same-day shipping. After I charged them up, I turned them on...paired my bluetooth...put them on...and what do you know, the left ear doesn't work at all. :( Thankfully Amazon is sending a replacement today, so fingers crossed the new set works as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Sleek, simple, and awesome. I have a large noggin (7-5/8"), and these fit with room to spare. The top band is soft, though not as soft as the similar Bose model. That said, I never took these off during a 9 hour flight and 2 hour airport wait. They sound great, the noise cancelling is solid, and the controls are efficient and easy. Oh, and the complaints about them breaking? Stop being so rough and impatient with expensive headphones! Seriously, you have to treat these pretty rough to break them. They come with a nice case - use it.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Gorgeous sound — spotty bluetooth
customer_reviews.text: The only issue with these superb headphones is that the bluetooth connection sometimes seems to stall — it stubbornly won’t connect even though the headphones say “bluetooth connected” and the devise (ipad) says the same. If I simply set the phones down beside the device and go about my business, it will usually connect after awhile. I actually have 2 lis of these phones - 1 connects right away. The other is slow (I exchanged it for a new pair, but there was no improvement. Still, I love the phones — typical gorgeous Sony sound quality!
customer_reviews.author: Scott B. Umstead

customer_reviews.title: Have both WH1000XM1 and WH1000XM2, still prefer the previous one
customer_reviews.text: Differences I can see between WH1000XM1 and WH1000XM2 WH1000XM2 has better battery and may have bit better noise cancelling, but it press your head lot more than previous generation, is bit uncomfortable for me. Something else I didn't like from WH1000XM2, they gave you two "voice warnings" of "low battery, please recharge headset", silencing all your sounds. This is ridiculously annoying for me as happens likely at 15% (~2hrs left) and 5% (30-40min left) and I left important things on meetings. WH1000XM1 just make red flashes and turns off with a voice sound.
customer_reviews.author: Pablo Cholaky

customer_reviews.title: The BEST noice cancellation performance, and almost as good as Bose in the sound department . . .
customer_reviews.text: LITERALLY got here in less than 24 hours with free Prime shipping, though I have no idea how, as I live WAY out in the boondocks! Either way, I was stoked to see them arrive, as they have amazing noice-cancellation features! Not nearly as comfortable as my old Bose QuietComfort 15s, but the noice-canceling is way better and the sound is almost comparable. I think I need to deepen the bass a little on my app settings, but so far I love these headphones, and am looking forward to using them on some long distance flights coming up soon. Loving the touch pad controls as well!
customer_reviews.author: Nice marmot!

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THESE HEADPHONES
customer_reviews.text: I bought these headphones and within months, they no longer turned on. Sony replaced them with another pair and now these no longer turn on either. I called to have these replaced and they said the warranty is up. Which is pretty frustrating because this was based on the first purchase and not the replacement pair. I kept them at my desk and always put back in the case. Was super careful with them. These were a pricey purchase and now out $300+ and Sony said there is nothing they can do to help me. Stay away from these and buy Beats or something different!
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: Some ambient but pretty good sound and comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: I'm at a noisy YMCA. The music they play came through my other headset. It was driving me crazy since my headset was all the way up. I figured that I'd try these Noise Canceling headphones. Tried the set yesterday. They work well, but still some ambient comes through. Not enough to be an issue any longer. Now I can go to the gym and listen to a podcast or what have you. Without trying other headphones I can't say with certainty these are the "best." And, I didn't like the 350.00 price tag. But you can't put a value on being irritated to the point of quitting a membership. Now I can go "in peace."
customer_reviews.author: Billy D

customer_reviews.title: premium quality and one of the best around
customer_reviews.text: The best headphone I've ever bought and even better noise canceling than my Bose QC 25. I have compared this cans and Bose QC 35 at BestBuy and fell in love at first try. Sound wise Sony is better than Bose, not too mention it has adaptive noise canceling. I know $300+ is not cheap but you get premium quality and one of the best around. The battery can power up to 25 hours and no need to charge more than a week. I have several cans range from AT, Bose, Phillips, AKG and Beats and this Sony is the best I have.
customer_reviews.author: whisnu

customer_reviews.title: I am truly happy I took time to check out reviews of various ...
customer_reviews.text: I am truly happy I took time to check out reviews of various headphones before springing for this expensive pair. I had bought some lesser products (always looking for deals) and ended up disappointed, but that taught me first-hand what quality and features are all about. These Sony Headphones had excellent reviews quite matching up with the Bose QC35, which had the advantage of lighter weight. But Sony's feature of pausing the ANC if you hold your hand on the right earphone won the day for me. Simply terrific and very convenient. Though these Sony and the Bose headphones are the same price, at the time I purchased the Sony were briefly available for $50.00. I grabbed the deal.
customer_reviews.author: Quixotic Guy

customer_reviews.title: Higly recomended.
customer_reviews.text: I belive this headfone should be ine of the best in the market. The sound quality is impressive, the features really works well and do what they promise. The active noise canceling does an amazing job without giving you any kind of headaches or any sizzles. Of course is an expensive toy but for those who are looking for the newest in technology's this is the option. The case and the finish are premium quality. Now, I expect sony could do this awesome job in a wateresistance device. I don't know if this is possible due to the mics which must capture the noises to cancel those but if could, woulb be amazing to wear it in rainy days.
customer_reviews.author: Bruno Paiva Paganoni

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic sounding headphones, but I'm returning them.
customer_reviews.text: These headphones sound amazing, and the noise cancelling is top notch. However, the tops of my ears start hurting after only 30 minutes to 1 hour of use. It's because the cups are shallow enough that my ears touch the foam protecting the driver. It gets bad enough that I have to take them off for a while. Re-adjusting them doesn't help. I really wanted to like these headphones, but I want something that I can wear for many hours without having discomfort.
customer_reviews.author: carlman14

customer_reviews.title: Most comfortable thing I have ever put on my head
customer_reviews.text: Most comfortable thing I have ever put on my head. Turn it on and it connects quickly, the noise cancelling immediately cutting in and transferring you to another world. Sound quality is stellar. These headphones are so good that it makes it hard to put anything else of lesser quality, basically every other product in existence, on you head or in your ears. After using these, you do get kind of spoiled. The touch features for pausing, calls, volume, and next and previous are easy to use, definitely a plus to not have to pull your phone out to make these kinds of adjustments. The rose gold color also looks amazing, far better than any other headphones around the office.
customer_reviews.author: Shane

customer_reviews.title: Great sounding headphones
customer_reviews.text: Great sounding headphones, fantastic noise canceling, awesome battery life. HUGE DISCLAIMER do not plan to be able to use this to speak with people on the phone. They will hear your environment and not you at all. The mic for his function is either terrible hardware or has some weird firmware/software issues sony needs to figure out. Real hassle. Otherwise for non-phone functions can't be beat.
customer_reviews.author: ZBates

customer_reviews.title: Not for people who like to crank it up - max volume barely above conversation level.
customer_reviews.text: I have had these headphones for just over a year. What is good: * Clarity and sound reproduction * Noise Cancelling is fantastic * Swipe volume control * Comfort What is bad: * Volume is barely above conversation level I contacted Sony and was referred to their website as if I were operating the phones incorrectly. I have the volume up as loud as it will go on the phones, pc volume control panel, and the bluetooth connection app volume and it is barely above conversation level. These are not for people who like to turn up the volume.
customer_reviews.author: Wylie Coyote

customer_reviews.title: Stylish in Japanese way
customer_reviews.text: Since other people write pro audio tech reviews, let me write something else. the gold color is not like shining color so its easy to match any of your clothing, and its not too casual, giving even formal feeling from the smooth surface. Also its imortant to note that Im male who doesn’t look girly at all by wearing this. In addition, its 12 degree here today, definitely good investment to walk in the NYC safely by enabling ambient mode on. I enabled voice focus mode on, and I was able to chat with my partner without taking out this headset under this cold weather. Perfect modern urban gear.
customer_reviews.author: Kiichi

customer_reviews.title: ... with some noise canceling capabilities and this were the best ones. I tried the browers and wilkings PX
customer_reviews.text: I've been a browers and wilkins p7 owner for the past 5 years and I was looking for something without cables and with some noise canceling capabilities and this were the best ones. I tried the browers and wilkings PX, the updated bose qx35 and the nuraphones (which were really cool and with an amazing sound but they weren't the complete package that I was looking for). I bought all 4 headphones at the same time and hardcore tested them for a full week going in the metro, outside, walking, etc. The Sony's were the best ones all around by far, even the app
customer_reviews.author: Javier

customer_reviews.title: I've had these for 3 or 4 years and they're still working fine.
customer_reviews.text: I've had these for 3 or 4 years but have mostly used them just for travel, always perform beautifully and keep outside noise to a minimum. Now that my husband and I are working from home as well as homeschooling there is a lot of noise in the office, where we're all working/schooling. I've been using them for my conference calls and they work perfect. Keeps out the background noise so I can hear and the attendees that I'm on the calls with hear very little from the background.
customer_reviews.author: Jill S.

customer_reviews.title: Although it may be pricey, they are worth it.
customer_reviews.text: The headphones have a very good fit to the desired head with a large range of adjustability. They fit and they stay there when still. Would not really recommend them for workouts because they can come off pretty easily. It is easy to forget that you are wearing them due to the comfort. The sound quality is incredible and can be adjusted to the use’s needs in the app. The noir cancellation can be controlled there as well. The noice cancellation works flawlessly and can be adjusted as well. The only downside may be the hardware. The plastic feels kind of cheap, but is still very durable and makes the headphones very light. Love them!!!
customer_reviews.author: Julia

customer_reviews.title: It is a great head phone
customer_reviews.text: It is a great head phone. It is comparable to the other brand with well recognized for noise cancelling head phone. I like the case and the wire jack more than the other brand. The case a soft separator between ear cups to prevent scratch. The head phone use standard 3.5mm for wire input while the other brand use 2.5mm. I subtract one star because of the touch control. I do like the cover the right ear cup to temporary stop noise cancelling function. I have problem with Volume up and forward track. The head phone mis-interpret a few times.
customer_reviews.author: HipGuy

customer_reviews.title: Awesome....
customer_reviews.text: These ROCK, good everything...Better than QC35, Bass is solid, almost as good as Bose, but I love everything else...as well as Longer battery life, Vol Controls are awesome gesture driven by swiping on Right Earcup surface. Lots of refinements, voice prompts a bit obnoxious. and once you get to know the button placement... As there is different modes of Sound Cancelling that are overkill, but I can see their point. You know Sony tries so hard...and these are Solid and Better than their predecessors by a long shot. Comfortable, as the earcups are a bit bigger for Big Elephant Ears....
customer_reviews.author: Brad Barnburner

customer_reviews.title: Noise cancellation is as good as Bose
customer_reviews.text: Noise cancellation is as good as Bose, perhaps better, as you can calibrate the noise cancellation to your environment by holding cancellation button. Sound quality and arguably aesthetics are slightly better, however still suffers from a loss of quality due to the cancellation, same as Bose. For environments where noise isn't an issue, I still prefer listening via Airpods/Earpods. Touch sensitive buttons on the side are a little annoying taking the headphones on and off, as you can accidentally adjust the volume or change the song. Additionally its difficult to remember which side button does what, as they are unmarked. Subtle markings would be helpful. Overall a very solid product and one of the few real contenders to Bose.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected - no gimmicks here
customer_reviews.text: Some said this one didn't beat the Bose QC35 and the fancy features were gimmicks. They were soooo wrong. I love the navigation and volume control gestures on the right ear cup. Brilliant design! Noise cancelling is stellar and sound quality is terrific. I am very satisfied. Pairing to my HP laptop and Samsung Galaxy Note 8 is a breeze. Havn't figured out the NFC pairing thing yet.
customer_reviews.author: David Roach

customer_reviews.title: Don't know what I would do without them.
customer_reviews.text: I travel 3 out 4 weeks in any given month, and have used these daily during most trips. They sound great and the battery last s a long time. As other reviews have mentioned, they can get a bit warm after a while. I used to have a set of Bose qc15's and these do sound better, and i love not being tied by cord. I do wish they were a bit better on phone calls, I can hear great, but my coworkers have complained about the volume of background noise they hear on calls. Most of the time, I have to switch to my Jabra headset for calls.
customer_reviews.author: HCW3

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, great noise cancelling
customer_reviews.text: Amazing noise cancelling. I could enjoy using these, but I prefer the Bose QC35. With these Sony’s, my ears get hot and there is too much clamping pressure. Plus I don’t like the white noise at low volume. That being said - the noise cancelling at anything above low volume blows Bose out of the water. If you really need to tune out, these could be a great choice. These are significantly better than the Beats Studio 3 wireless headphones. I’ll stick with the Bose for now though.
customer_reviews.author: Techguy

customer_reviews.title: I Love These Every Day of My Life
customer_reviews.text: I know, it sounds like a love affair. It is. I have a daily meditation practice so I want to be transported, removed from the planet, taken away to somewhere distant and magical. My Sonys take me there. This is maybe TMI, but with my eyes closed and in the dark, I can reach up and increase or decrease the volume, stop the track or go forward or backward. It's a love affair I plan on keeping going a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley Charbonneau

customer_reviews.title: Good headphones. Bad for calls.
customer_reviews.text: The headphones are great. The noise cancelling puts you in a bubble of solitude, especially when you have some audio playing. Audio quality is on par with other headphones in the same price range. I'm The ambient sound feature is fantastic, the highlight being "focus on voices". Now for a couple of gripes: There is no background noise cancelling for phone calls. People can't hear me if I try to use these to place calls. The won't stay on if they aren't connected to Bluetooth.
customer_reviews.author: N. Killgore

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and works well
customer_reviews.text: The ear pads are soft and comfortable. I was able to wear these much longer than other headphones. I wear glasses at the computer and use these to drown out an office mate who talks to herself constantly. They do a pretty good job just with the noise cancelling on, but to completely drown her out I need something playing. I've been using piano music instrumentals (much less distracting than anything with singing) and I'm looking for a white noise loop I could use. I had to convince my supervisor to get these (more expensive) but I think they are worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara A. Carlson

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for work air travel and they work great. They block out almost all of the noise on the plane. I also use them when mowing the lawn and they do a good job blocking the engine noise of my zero turn as well. I have used them for close to 8 hours strain on a plane, and the battery could have done double that. No issues with cracking yet, and I check for it every time I use them. My only complaint is that they do make my ears a bit hot (and covered area). I am a little concerned with moisture from sweating, but so far no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Paul

customer_reviews.title: Awesome spacious sound! Sony’s Q35 killer packs quite the punch
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic headphones. Was going to wait for Sony’s Bluetooth 5.0 headphones next year but couldn’t resist buying these. I’m glad I did though. They sound clean, crisp and precise. Very spacious sound. They look and feel great as well. They do get hot though after a while. More so than most headphones so I would like to see that improved in the next model. Lots of features and settings as well which is nice. Give em a try, I think you’ll enjoy them.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Great sound and noise cancelling but cheaply made and snapped in two
customer_reviews.text: Great headphones, but flawed design. Mine broke in the same spot that everyone is complaining about. But that's OK, Sony, I only paid three hundred fifty bucks, no biggie. Update two months later: I managed to find a used replacement for the broken bit on (auction site) and I fixed it. Now, two months later, the other side has broken, so I again bought a replacement used part and fixed it. I am out fifty clams because Sony under-engineered these otherwise excellent headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer 9979

customer_reviews.title: Sleek headphones, ANC is amazing.
customer_reviews.text: These are great headphones, the active sound canceling I can't hear anything other than what is playing through the headphones, can't even hear myself talk. These are perfect for Fortnite, you can pin point where the enemy is in a building or where they are shooting from. Sound quality is great for BT 4.0 headphones. Would have given them 5 stars but if you do not seat them on your ears to where they slide in, the pressure they have on the ear after long periods of time will be uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Dana

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: These headphones sound great. I was between these and Bose but I felt the bose sounded too artificial. The Sony’s have a nice soundstage with accurate mids and highs, and a nice punchy bass. Comfort is top notch, with little fatigue after long listening sessions. Noise canceling is amazing, the world becomes silent and I think it’s better than bose. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: JNG

customer_reviews.title: Wanted to like them. Bose QC35 II are better.
customer_reviews.text: Bought both the Bose and Sony’s (2x) to compare them. While the Sony ANC is slightly better and they have a bit more bass, they’re just too uncomfortable. The Sony mobile app is more advanced, but at end of the day, if you cannot wear them for very long without them hurting your ears, they’re not viable. If you’ve been torn between these models like I was, save yourself the headache (literally) and get the Bose. Wish it hadn’t taken me a month to arrive at this conclusion.
customer_reviews.author: miles267

customer_reviews.title: A little expensive and worth it
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable. I wear them on 15-20 hour overseas flights for listening (music/movies) and noise cancellation (sleeping). Excellent sound quality. Good battery life (25-30 hrs). Easy to use (right ear cup has a variety of touch controls). Be sure and download the app if you like to fine tune your listening experience and 'manage' your headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: These Sony Noise Cancelling Headphones are great at noise reduction especially on planes
customer_reviews.text: These Sony Noise Cancelling Headphones come in a well- made zippered case. They are great at noise reduction especially on planes, where engine noise can be very bothersome. I use them wirelessly, frequently on cross country flights, and this feature coupled with their fine dynamic range allow me to enjoy all types of music peacefully. I tried other brands of headphones but I really enjoy these best, and recommend them to anyone interested in purchasing a good set of headphones at a very reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: NittanyLion

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones. Noise cancellation ability is top notch.
customer_reviews.text: It's just less than a week I've had these headphones and from what I've seen so far I can guarantee that the quality is absolutely spectacular. The physical appeal (looks and quality) is amazing (made with really soft materials that will let you use this for long time - I tried this non-stop for 4 hours and didn't feel any discomfort whatsoever) and also the sound quality is excellent. Noise-cancellation feature is unbelievably top-notch. After taking these headphones off from your ears you do feel how noisy the world is :). I have not tried the microphone for the calls yet. I will try that and update my comment here soon.
customer_reviews.author: Chaitanya K

customer_reviews.title: LOVE these headphones
customer_reviews.text: LOVE these headphones. My girlfriend has the Bose and as I travel a lot I wanted noise cancelling, wireless and great sound quality. We just took and 2 1/2 plane ride and we both tried each others out. Noise cancelling is pretty much the same on both. However we both agreed that the sound on the Sonys were much better, especially the bass. It's not overpowering like Beats but much better than her Bose. I didn't think I'd care for the ear cup features but we both loved the way you can cup the right ear piece to pause our music or movies to actually hear without removing the headphones. Great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Sound good but make ears hot
customer_reviews.text: These headphones have above average sound, amazing noise canceling, and are super comfortable... except for the fact that they warm up my ears very quickly. After about 30 minutes, my ears would be burning and bright red. It would take several hours for the sensation to go away. I think this is because the earpads don't provide for much breathing room, or maybe the material just didn't agree with my skin. If it weren't for this issue, these headphones would be 5 stars. Ultimately, I had to return them because it just wasnt possible to wear them for longer periods, my ears would get too warm.
customer_reviews.author: gotosleep

customer_reviews.title: these Sony Headphones are fantastic! Charge them and the charge lasts a long ...
customer_reviews.text: I had previously purchased a pair of "noise cancelling" headphones for a "deal" at $99. I could cover my ears with my hands and blocked more sound. That was them: these Sony Headphones are fantastic! Charge them and the charge lasts a long time. Turn on the noise cancelling features and I can't believe how well it works. My neighbor was mowing his yard and I put my set on. I light drone was all I heard. Then I turned on music and all I could hear was the music. I haven't had a pair of Bose, but if they work better than the Sonys, I doubt it would be worth the price asked for the Bose.
customer_reviews.author: William LAmoreaux

customer_reviews.title: No CVC noise cancelling means horrible call quality. No one can hear you if it’s noisy. FAIL
customer_reviews.text: I wear these in a noisy lab environment paired to an iPhone. ANC is great cancelling the drone of the fans, pumps etc running in the lab, but anytime I need to take a phone call, forget it. No one can hear me. Without CVC (6.0 is the standard, latest is now 8.0), these are useless for taking phone calls. Even the newer WH1000XM3 has no CVC at all, so they will be equally useless for taking phone calls. Shame that I can buy $30 earbuds that have CVC 8.0, while Sony ignores the technology completely.
customer_reviews.author: duc916

customer_reviews.title: Replaced Bose QC25 - couldn't be happier
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to replace my old wired Bose QC25 headphones. I love them. Some of the highlights for me: - Long battery life and battery indicator when connected to my iPhone 8 so I know when to charge them - Controls on right ear are fantastic. Ability to instantly stop/start/vol up & down/next song is incredibly convenient - Range is awesome, on par with my Apple Airpods. Just now I left my phone in my seat (8C on a 737) and used the restroom at the rear of the plane. No disconnect or degradation whatsoever. - Sound isolation as good or better than the QC25. Very highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: sloant

customer_reviews.title: I can see why it is always being flip/flopped with the Bose QC for best in class
customer_reviews.text: This is a quality set of NC Bluetooth headphones. I can see why it is always being flip/flopped with the Bose QC for best in class. The features are really cool, especially the pass through voice. The swipe functions are not as convenient as it sounds though. The QC is on par with Bose. I liked the sound better than the Bose, which to me sounds thin and a bit too bright. However, that may be simply my taste. Folds into a compact case very neatly. Perfect for travel. Excellent battery life. Having said that, I do prefer the B&W PX. I bought both and gave these to my wife and kept the B&W.
customer_reviews.author: Ein

customer_reviews.title: Build quality does not match price
customer_reviews.text: The noise cancelling and sound quality of this set of headphones is nothing short of superb. Comfortable fit to the head. The touch controls take some getting used to, but once you are familiar, provide a high degree of ease of use. Battery lasts forever. However, the build quality is not up to the price paid. Point in fact, it's utter garbage. Like so many other users have reported, the body cracked at the earcup hinge. For a set of headphones that cost over $300, I expected better. I will not be purchasing another set of SONY headphones since I can't trust that they will last.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Wheeling

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality - but they still hurt my head
customer_reviews.text: When I have them on, I really can't hear anything else going on in my noisy house and nobody can hear what I'm listening to, either. Connecting them with Bluetooth on both my smart TV and my laptop was fairly simple. When I wear them for a long time, I get head pain on the top of my head from the plastic band. I have not found a pair of headphones yet that this doesn't happen with. The ear cups are soft and comfortable on the ears.
customer_reviews.author: Blue Blazes

customer_reviews.title: Good sound quality, less good as handsfree
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality and noise cancelling is very good. Battery time is amazing. The only thing I do not like is that compared to my Bose QC15, the handsfree function is not very good. Particularly in noisy areas the sounds cuts in short intervals. The reason might be that the microphone is not on the cable. For listening to music these are great, but do not buy them as a handsfree set if you are going to talk a lot in noisy areas.
customer_reviews.author: Havard Grande Urhamar

customer_reviews.title: Unit seems sturdy to me
customer_reviews.text: I love the unit. It has great sound in my opinion and I never have had an issues so far (1 month). I enjoy the app and the features. They're very intuitive. I use it for making phone calls and no one has had a problem with hearing me. If I did it all over again I'd get this unit. I'm very pleased and impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: The best headphones I’ve ever had.
customer_reviews.text: Simply sublime! Bought them for $200 thanks to Black Friday and my satisfaction is complete. They are very comfortable, give you a rich and 3d sound, full of details. Full of functions that the owner will appreciate like excellent noise cancelling. For example you can hear external noise just by covering you right can. After uncovering, the noise is completely cancelled. The ipad or cell phone application helps to adjust it to your personal preference and update the firmware. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Rodolfo Tacsan Ch

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely in love
customer_reviews.text: I've been wanting a pair of noise-cancelling headphones for years now, but the price always turned me off. I had a pair of less expensive, over-ear Sennheiser (non-noise-cancelling) headphones, but they did nothing to cover up the sound of airplane engines. I do a lot of flying, so I decided to splurge when I saw these $20 less than the previous price. I am really glad I did! Everything about them is top notch! The build, audio, battery life, and noise cancelling quality. They also fold up nice and small. I absolutely love them!
customer_reviews.author: Scott Sander

customer_reviews.title: Better than Bose
customer_reviews.text: Much much much better than the Bose QC 35 II!!! I had the Bose first and returned them because of the sound quality was much worse than the Audio Technica ath m50x's. I held out hope for these based on the reviews I've seen and I am not disappointed at all, the sony sound much more dynamic and have a good sound depth with features o so many features these are clearly the new Kings if the industry
customer_reviews.author: Annie A.

customer_reviews.title: It's great in every aspect except two
customer_reviews.text: Bluetooth is kind of oldschool to connect. It works great but it isn't as quick and easy as the standard today. Not a big issue. The big problem for me is comfort. It isn't so comfortable and I own a lot of headphones which don't give me issue. They just apply pressure on the ear which is not very comfortable. They are more low-key, nicer looking, and maybe better sounding than all the competitors, but this model isn't getting as much use as it could because of comfort. There is a new model (with usb-c) which looks to have enlarged the earpads. I would consider that pair.
customer_reviews.author: E. Raitses

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny! Must have for frequent traveler.  Great noise cancelling and amazing battery life.
customer_reviews.text: I love these headphones!!!! The noise cancelling is amazing, a must have when flying. Great for blocking out background noise, totally saved my flight when a crying baby was on the plane. Sound is great, clear highs and strong bass... all in balance. The bluetooth connection is very stable. The microphone in the headphones is extremely sensitive and can be a bit much when using for phone calls. The battery life is astounding... charge it up before a business trip and I dont have to worry about it until I get home. Worth every penny!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Norris

customer_reviews.title: Still happy three years later
customer_reviews.text: I have had these for nearly three years now. Still going strong. Sounds very good, noticeably reduces all annoying background/house noises, great for work from home. The most noticeable noise cancelling moment I had was on the airplane when I streamed a full movie, starting the moment I sat down, then took them off at the end and WOW THIS PLANE IS LOUD! Didn't even notice with them on
customer_reviews.author: N. F. C..

customer_reviews.title: Good adjustable noise cancellation, but poor quality listening to classical music.
customer_reviews.text: Comparing to the Bose QC Series I have, this is OK. The plus on this is the iOS app having the ability to adjust the noise cancellation and calibrate it. It can be used both as a wireless or wired headphone. Listening to normal music was good, such as adult contemporary. However, when listening to classical music, piano music, or instrumental music, there is a variation of static sound when it hit a particular pitch. It is quite annoying when you are trying to listen to calm music. But if the purchase is to listen to current modern rock or hip-hop, this does an ok job.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin T. Nguyen-tu

customer_reviews.title: Provides solitude and my own slice of heaven.
customer_reviews.text: I use these when traveling. I can sit in the airport or plane, turn on my music and noise cancelling and hear nothing of what's going on around me. I just sit there and peacefully watch people - reduces my stress traveling 100%. I was on a trip and staying in a downtown hotel when a street festival started on the street below me. Egads! It was horrid. I couldn't sleep. Finally I grabbed these headphones, turned on music and noise canceling and I was totally at peace. I'm so glad I purchased them.
customer_reviews.author: Maureen

customer_reviews.title: These headphones are great. I'm really impressed by the sound and noise-cancelling ...
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are great. I'm really impressed by the sound and noise-cancelling feature. It's a godsend at work—in an open office where people can't keep their voices down and distracting noise just carries everywhere. These headphones have made a huge difference in my mental health and wellbeing. My only criticism is that the they can sometimes be a bit heavy, and probably are not the best fit for my head shape. Otherwise, they're great.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Sound is great, Noise cancelling not so much.
customer_reviews.text: The noise cancelling feature doesn't work unless you are listening to something. Without the Bluetooth connection, the headphones turn off. Want to just block out noise without listening to something? Don't buy these.
customer_reviews.author: Thom Wright

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable and excellent noise cancellation.
customer_reviews.text: I got these after checking out an older pair at Costco and reading the reviews. I have several headphones now (I think I’m turning into a collector). These sound pretty good and love the ability of using the EQ in the app to customize what I’m listening to. So far so good! Noise cancelling is excellent... wish they got a bit louder, but will suffice. Update 4/1/18: Well, apparently the thing about "breaking in" headphones is true, the sound on these things have really opened up a bit.. and they are incredible sounding... I have tried many different genres of music as my taste is eclectic. Color me impressed.. the sound separation in musical instruments is amazing.
customer_reviews.author: J.C. Ross

customer_reviews.title: Great noise reduction, good sound
customer_reviews.text: These headphones were a lifesaver on a recent flight. I ended up sitting right by the engine, and it was incredibly loud. When I put these headphones on, the noise disappeared almost completely! An occasional bit of conversation still filtered in, but the drone of the noise was removed quite effectively. The audio quality is very good. I prefer the Bose sound signature, but these are OK, and luckily, they are also very customizable via the app's EQ function.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Useless for Phone Calls
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed with the quality when using the headset to make calls. Everything was great until I joined my first conference call at work, the recipients on the other end couldn't hear anything from me but enhanced background noise. Unless you're sitting in a soundproof box, you'll have to remove your headphones to take phone calls. (Yes, I've tested this lol) I was between these and the Bose QuietComfort 35, and I'm beginning to really regret my decision to purchase headphones that cannot be used for phone calls.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Niehues

customer_reviews.title: Great product, and perfect price
customer_reviews.text: My sons have used Beats headphones in the past, and we've always been underwhelmed. This year we purchased this pair of Sony headphones based on outside reviews, and we were not disappointed. So much better in quality than the Beats competitors. The noise-canceling feature is legit - he can't hear a thing when wearing, and quality of sound is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: bvanderpol

customer_reviews.text: Excelent headphones, couldn't be happier. I was undecided if i got these or the Bose QuietComfort 35 II, but i'm glad that i've choosen sony's. The noise canceling is excelent, and no doubt the best on the market, but it's not perfect. I can have conversations with it and understand the person clearly, until there is something playing on the headphones, then i would only hear something if the person yells.
customer_reviews.author: Cristian

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sound and noise cancelling
customer_reviews.text: Excellent sound AND noise cancelling technology. Worked great on a flight to muffle screaming children. Do not purchase if you want to sit in silence - the Bose QC35 may be better for that purpose - but do purchase if you are searching for the best sound quality in a wireless noise cancelling headphone. Sony's new HiRes LDAC wireless codec works flawlessly with Android 8.0+ devices (and hi fidelity music!). And, extra features are available with Apple devices via phone app or via the SBC codec on Android.
customer_reviews.author: jwf

customer_reviews.title: No cracking
customer_reviews.text: It took me months of research to finally buy these in Nov 2017, especially with my concern of cracking. I have used them almost daily since their purchase and love them. No cracks. My only complaint is after wearing for a prolonged period your ears get hot. Otherwise they are great. Noise canceling is wonderful, especially when flying but also around the house or work.
customer_reviews.author: Aym

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound
customer_reviews.text: These have great sound and the sound cancellation is awesome. There are 2 demerits though. If you turn on ambient sound, sound your spouse doesn't make you dirty your undies, there's a pretty loud hiss. Second, some unfinished production games (Fallout 76) will use the Hands Free driver instead of the normal one, thus appearing to mute the headphones altogether, resulting in hours of debugging. The latter is a game issue, but know that this issue can exist.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Frailey

customer_reviews.title: Best headphones I've ever had
customer_reviews.text: I love these headphones. Perfect for frequent travelling. Excellent sound, great noise cancelling. I upgraded from another pair of Sony Bluetooth headphones that I thought were pretty good... Until I tried these. Definitely worth the upgrade. I think they are the best headphones you can get at the price and much better than some that are more expensive.
customer_reviews.author: KSZ

customer_reviews.title: Broke in less than 2 years
customer_reviews.text: I used this product regularly for last than 2 years when I started experiencing battery issues (ie, battery lasting less than 1 hour). I sent the headphones to Sony’s authorized service center (United Radio) and they could not fix the issue (after $50 charge). Before the battery situation my only issue was the microphone. If you expect to join conference calls with these headphones, forget it. The microphone is better at capturing background noise than your voice. My understanding is this product will not work for two years. There are too many moving / feeble parts to make it a solid product. There are competitors who will provide a better product for similar price.
customer_reviews.author: Marcos Garrison Dytz

customer_reviews.title: Stop now, buy these!
customer_reviews.text: Quality, Great Fit, Amazing Functions. Get these if you've been comparing and reading reviews for way too long! I love love love these! After using Beats for years at the gym, then switching to Bose Quiet Comforts for traveling, and now using these ALL THE TIME, I am obsessed. I got a pair of returned ones for a cheaper price and everything was fully intact and in new condition, except the charging cord was missing, this isn't a problem because who doesn't have a micro-usb cord laying around somewhere?
customer_reviews.author: Alexis LaRubbio

customer_reviews.title: with great bass. The noise canceling system works even too ...
customer_reviews.text: I am not an audiophile but I own several closed headphones including a Master and Dynamics wireless headphones and a Bose with ambient Noise reduction. These are my preferred headphones. The sound is very clear, with great bass. The noise canceling system works even too well ( sometimes I am afraid that somebody will take away the house around me and I will not be able to hear a thing). Anyway, overall I think these are the best sounding headphones I have.
customer_reviews.author: Paolo

customer_reviews.title: Gamers must read.
customer_reviews.text: The best thing in my life hahah Really it's a perfect one specially the noise cancelation.. For me this model is better than the new one... Because the ear pad in new model is pushing on the ear. It comes with aux cable without microphone so it's not working on ps4 gaming chat... You have to buy aux cable with microphone to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Sami Almokhalfi

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase for this frequent flyer
customer_reviews.text: Great sound, Decent noise cancelling (IEM's are better), I like SOME of the hand gesture controls but I wish the user could opt-out of the volume and track-change gestures. There is a handy app that should allow you to better configure these. If you accidentally touch your right ear-cup, the track can change or pause - annoying. Also the over ear design can be hot on warm planes.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Ireland

product_meta.title: Sony Noise Cancelling Headphones WH1000XM2: Over Ear Wireless Bluetooth Headphones with Microphone - Hi Res Audio and Active Sound Cancellation - Black (2017 model)
product_meta.description:
Color:BlackDIGITAL NOISE CANCELLATION 
Sony’s WH-1000XM2 premium noise-canceling headphones let you completely immerse yourself in your music anytime, anywhere. Bluetooth and NFC technology offer wireless freedom, while industry-leading noise cancellation blocks out background noise. 

SMART LISTENING 
Smart Listening by Adaptive Sound Control detects your activities and environment in order to adjust the ambient sound accordingly. Download the Sony | Headphones Connect App for Android/iOS to customize your settings and hear audio optimized for where you are and what you’re doing. 

TOUCH CONTROL 
With a swipe of a fingertip on the right ear cup, you can control tracks and volume, use your phone’s voice assistant, and take or make phone calls. Double tap for hands-free calling, and place your hand over the entire cup to instantly lower the volume for conversation. 

HI-RES AUDIO 
A 40mm driver pairs with Sony’s DSEE HX software for powerful hi-resolution audio, ensuring you’re hearing music the way it was meant to be heard. S-Master HX technology also enhances the sound and reduces distortion, while LDAC wireless streaming transmits data in a flash. 

- Industry leading noise cancellation as of August 31, 2017 according to research by Sony Corporation and measured using JEITA compliant guidelines. 
- Battery life will vary based on your unique setting, environmental conditions and usage. Interoperability and compatibility among Bluetooth devices may vary. 
- Customized sound requires download of the Sony | Headphones Connect app for iPhone from the App Store or for Android from Google Play. User must link compatible devices in order to control operation. Subject to app terms and conditions. 
- Headphones are only compatible with High-Resolution audio when wired. 
- Voice assist function is compatible with an Android smartphone (Google App) or iPhone (Siri). Bluetooth connection is required.
feature_bullets: DIGITAL NOISE CANCELATION: Industry leading noise canceling eliminates distracting background noises
SMART LISTENING: Quickly detects your activity to automatically adjust the ambient sounds you hear
QUICK ATTENTION MODE: Cover the right ear cup to turn down your music for instant, easy conversation; Battery Charge Time: Approx. 4 hours
TOUCH CONTROL: Skip a track, change the volume and take or make calls just by touching a headphone
FAST CHARGING: Enjoy up to 30 hrs of cordless NC and a 10 min quick charge for 70 more mins of play.Frequency Response (Active Operation):4 Hz–40,000 Hz
WIRED OR WIRELESS: Go hands free or plug in the over-ear headset for streaming and noise reduction
VOICE ASSISTANT: Activate your cell phones voice assistant with a simple touch on the right earphone
WHAT’S INCLUDED: Adjustable earphones with mic, portable case, airplane adaptor, cables and manual

Connectivity Technology: Bluetooth. Frequency Response - 4 Hz-40,000 Hz , Impedance - 46 ohm (1 kHz) (when connecting via the headphone cable with the unit turned on), 14 ohm (1 kHz) (when connecting via the headphone cable with the unit turned off)
